intro: Rhynchospora stricta, commonly known as the rigid spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes that are typically greenish or brownish in color. Rhynchospora stricta is often found in shallow water or saturated soil, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems. Its structure and growth habits make it well adapted to its moist, often nutrient-poor habitats.
